text: What kind of folder structure do you'll use to digitally  organize random code-bits and  coding projects?

elements.text: What kind of folder structure do you'll use to digitally  organize random code-bits and  coding projects?

text:
I'm converging upon
```~/OneDrive/Code
├── .Archive  # archived projects no longer active 
├── 0 Playground   # random code playing around with that's not totally random
├── 1 Scratch  # random junk code that I can probably safely get rid of
├── 3 Notes  # mic. notes and tips 
├── 4 Repos  # repos copied form github etc.
├── 5 Resources  # resources related to code and downloads of projects etc.
├── Project 1   # active project 1
└── Project 2  # another active project```

├── .Archive  # archived projects no longer active

├── 1 Scratch  # random junk code that I can probably safely get rid of
├── 3 Notes  # mic. notes and tips 
├── 4 Repos  # repos copied form github etc.
├── 5 Resources  # resources related to code and downloads of projects etc.
├── Project 1   # active project 1
└── Project 2  # another active project

text: I just looked at Dr Watson a few hours ago. Looks like a good layout.

elements.text: I just looked at Dr Watson a few hours ago. Looks like a good layout.

text: But that's for a julia project. I'm discussing general digital files.

elements.text: But that's for a julia project. I'm discussing general digital files.

text: yep I pretty much do what you are doing

elements.text: yep I pretty much do what you are doing

text:
```Code
├── .Archive   # archived projects no longer active
├── Playground # random code that's not totally scratch but also not a full project
├── Projects   # active projects live here, mainly those that don't live on GitHub
├── References # Notes, random resources related to code, downloads of random files
├── Repos      # repos that live on Github etc.
└── Scratch    # storage for scratch files that can be deleted, but choose not to```

elements.text:
Code
├── .Archive   # archived projects no longer active
├── Playground # random code that's not totally scratch but also not a full project
├── Projects   # active projects live here, mainly those that don't live on GitHub
├── References # Notes, random resources related to code, downloads of random files
├── Repos      # repos that live on Github etc.
└── Scratch    # storage for scratch files that can be deleted, but choose not to

text:
I don’t like to type so much, so I set up single character directories. Because of security changes in macOS, I now have to put them under ~ (my home directory), but unfortunately Julia functions usually don’t expand that.
I have different ones for different consulting clients.
~/j for Julia and other 3rd party repos, ~/s for my own repos (all the ones in the JuliaString organization, plus a few more), ~/z for Zapata Computing, etc.
